page.title: 05 Motney Hill sewage works 2
page.content: Sewage entering the works is screened initially to remove plastic bags and other solids which might block pumps and machinery. The flowing sewage then enters a settling tank where it remains for about 10 minutes. This allows heavy grit to settle out but not other lighter solids.In the main settling tank, which the sewage then enters colloidal solids settle out after about four hours.This material is removed as sludge. The remaining liquid can at this stage be discharged directly into the estuary.This is because tidal action disperses sewage effectively. Inland sewage works are required to treat liquid further to remove bacteria etc.before discharge into rivers. The solid sludge is placed in anaerobic digester tanks where bacteria break down the sludge before it is dried comprssed and dumped on the site.
